intro: Puccinellia coarctata, commonly known as narrowleaf saltbush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in saline or alkaline soils, often found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, including drought and high salinity. Puccinellia coarctata plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for livestock in its native habitats.
